citeinfo.title: State Administered Lands with MNDNR Interest

pubinfo.publish: MNDNR - Division of Lands and Minerals

descript.abstract:
MNDNR land ownership and administrative interest mapped to the PLS forty level. This layer merges the MNDNR Control Point Generated PLS layer with IBM mainframe-based land records. The data are limited to a forty level resolution. Therefore, holdings that are less than a forty in extent are represented as a full forty in the data (although specific fields exist within the attribute tables that allow the user to identify these). See individual metadata links below. By Administrator:
  • County
  • Ecological Resources
  • Fisheries
  • Forestry
  • Other DNR Units
  • Parks and Recreation
  • Trails and Waterways
  • Wildlife
By Interest Type:
  • Fee and Other Interests
  • Easement Interests
By State Conservation Easements - MS Chapter 84C:
  • State Conservation Easements
  • State Conservation Easements - no matches mapped to section
By Type:
  • Acquired
  • Consolidated Conservation
  • Federal Lease
  • Tax Forfeit
  • Trust Fund
  • Volstead
descript.purpose: To provide MNDNR resource managers and land records specialists access to MNDNR land records information in GIS format.

timeperd.current: Time Period of Content date indicates the date which the user can be confident of accuracy and completeness of the dataset. PLS forty geometry and base information dates range from 1998 vintage to modern surveys, and incorporates survey notes from the late 1800s to present.

theme.themekey: planningCadastre, land ownership, public land survey, PLS, land stewardship, natural resources

idinfo.useconst: Use of the data are constrained only by the DNR GIS Data License Agreement. See the Distribution Liability section below for a link.

dataqual.logic: Polygon(s) are coincident, verified closed, and intersect where intended.
dataqual.complete: Data are exhaustive within those geographic areas covered, although statewide coverage is not yet available. Only those forties on which MNDNR has a land interest are included.

horizpa.horizpar: Variable. At its least accurate, the geometries are based upon points derived from manual digitizing of PLS section corners from 1:24,000 scale paper media (GISMO and SECTIC-24K points). At its most accurate, the data is based upon points collected using GPS units operating at a sub-meter level of accuracy. Refer to the ACCURACY and METHOD fields in the related DNR PLS Control Point Inventory, for specific information.

attr.attrdef: County identified using a 2-digit number from 1 to 87.
PLS township number. If the township number ends with ".5", it is the half township - 58.5, range 17.
PLS range number
PLS section number
PLS government lot number
Parcel number - currently not used. The original intent of this field was to use this code in relation to the forty or government lot to identify unique parcels.
PLS forty (quarter-quarter) description using text. The descriptions should be read in the following way: NWNE is the Northwest 1/4 of the Northeast 1/4.
The Land Records sequence number, a primary key in the Land Records.
DNR document number
County Document number.
County PIN number
The number of acres that have a State-owned interest within the PLS forty or government covered by this record.

The percent of the surface area of the PLS forty or government lot that is state owned. LPCT40 = LACRES/(GLO acres for the forty or government lot) * 100. If the number is less than 100, this record does not include the entire forty or government lot.
State surface ownership.

edom.edomvd: Uncertain - generally means that there is a transaction in process

attr.attrdef: Surface undivided interest given as a percentage.
State owned mineral interest

edom.edomvd: Uncertain - State asserts that it owns minerals, not researched

attr.attrdef: Mineral undivided interest given as a percentage.
Type of ownership interest as a 1-character code.
Type of ownership interest as a text description.
Land type as a 1-character code.
Land type as a text description.
Means of acquisition as a 1-character code.
Means of acquisition as a text description.
DNR public use administrator name.
DNR public use administrator program as a 3-character code.
DNR public use administrator program name.
DNR public use administrator project code as a 5-digit number.
DNR public use administrator program/project name.
DNR administrator code as a 2-digit number.
DNR administrator management program as a 3-character code.
DNR administrator program/project as an 8-character code.
Land Record change date, given as MM/DD/YYYY. Indicates when the record was added or last changed.
Download date - the date when the record was downloaded from the Land Records and matched to PLS40
PLS Range direction as a number, 0, 1, or 2, rather than West, East, West - half township or half range

edom.edomvd: West, but represents a half township (T58.5N R17W in St. Louis county) or half range (T160N R42.5W and T159N R42.5W in Roseau county)

attr.attrdef: The geocoding field used to match the Land Records to the PLS40 base layer. The format of this field is as follows: CCTTTDRRSSFFGG, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, RR is RANG, SS is SECT, FF is FORT or "00" (see following note), and GG is GLOT. Note: if the GLOT is greater than 0, such as government lot 1, the FF part of GLOTMATCH is set to 00.

A PLS description to the section level. It is a combination of the COUN, TOWN, RDIR, RANG, and SECT fields. The format of this field is as follows: CCTTTDRRSS, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, and SS is SECT.

A PLS description to the township and range level. It is a combination of the COUN, TOWN, RDIR, and RANG fields. The format of this field is as follows: CCTTTDRR, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, and RR is RANG.
The county name.

PLS forty number (that is, the quarter-quarter section), rather than a text description such as NWNE. (FORT is based on the MLMIS40 codes that have been used in the state for many years.) In cases where there is a government lot, the FORT code provides a locational reference to where the government lot can be found in the section.

First government lot East of NESE

attr.attrdef: PLS township direction listed as N - North.
PLS Range direction where W - West and E - East.

An old, Bureau of Real Estate Management Land Records code for PLS forties - intended for internal use only. Generally matches the FORT field (which is LMAP40 in the Land Records), but there are additional values for fractional forties and references to other information.

edom.edomvd: Other - see status card in Land Records

attr.attrdef: Transaction number, listed as six characters.
Land Record added or last changed - year, given as a 4-digit number.
Land Record added or changed - month, given as a 2-digit number.
Land Record added or last changed - day, given as a 2-digit number.
DNR administrator program/project name.
DNR administrator program name.
DNR administrator name.
DNR public use administrator program/project code as a combination of PUPGM and PUPRJ fields.

DNR public use administrator as a 2-digit code. In several locations around the state, there is more than one DNR administrator. The PUADMIN field indicates the designated administrator of the public use and is used for determining payment-in-liew of taxes (PILT).
DNR Region as a 1-digit number.
DNR Region area (field unit) code.
Transaction type, given as a 2-character code.
Acquisition date given as a number in the following format: YYYYMMDD where YYYY is the 4-digit year, MM is the 2-digit month, and DD is the 2-digit day.
Acquisition date given as a text field, formatted as follows: MM/DD/YYYY, where MM is month, DD is day, and YYYY is year.
DNR Document type as a 1-character code. Refer to the XDOCTP field in the dataset for a list of the text descriptions for document type.
DNR document type as a text description.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).
